title: Germany's conservatives led by Merz win election, far-right AfD follows in second
summary: The conservative CDU/CSU alliance led by Friedrich Merz won Sunday's elections with between 28.5 and 29 percent of the vote, according to first TV exit polls. The far-right AfD followed in second place with 19.5 to 20 percent.

title: Pope Francis remains in critical condition as global prayers pour in
summary: Vatican officials said Sunday that Pope Francis’s condition remains critical as he enters his 10th day in the hospital, though he has not suffered another respiratory attack since Saturday morning. The 88-year-old pontiff continues to receive high-flow oxygen and blood transfusions, with doctors monitoring signs of early-stage renal failure.

title: Save Gaza to save Europe
summary: It's not too late to realize that the fate of European integration is intimately linked to that of the Palestinian enclave, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Culture, Ukraine's other existential battle
summary: Since the start of the Russian invasion, Ukrainian authorities and artists have been mobilizing to build a national narrative, sparking heated debates ranging from total rejection to a desire for reappropriation.

title: France arrests 10 linked to gang leader's escape, with Romania set to extradite him
summary: The Paris chief prosecutor said those arrested are alleged to have helped in the escape of Mohamed Amra in a deadly prison van ambush nine months ago.

title: Increasingly progressive women and conservative men: Why the ideological divide is widening among young people
summary: Far from their reputation as 'woke,' the younger generations are divided on feminist issues, which is reflected in their political affiliation, notes political scientist Anja Durovic.

title: Zelensky offers to resign in exchange for Ukrainian NATO membership
summary: Zelensky also said he wants to meet with Donald Trump before the US president meets his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. His remarks come on the eve of the third anniversary of Russia's invasion.

title: 15 great-value restaurants for lunch in and around Paris
summary: From Latino restaurants to vegetarian canteens, French gastronomy to Roman specialties, here's our selection of gourmet eateries at reasonable prices.

title: France hammers Italy 73-24 in Six Nations with 11-try masterclass
summary: Les Bleus are now three points behind Ireland after bouncing back convincingly from their narrow and painful defeat at the hands of England.

title: Macron to visit Washington, hoping to use 'unique' relationship to sway Trump
summary: In a trip to Washington on Monday, the French president is expected to urge Donald Trump to consider the safety of America's allies in the talks with Vladimir Putin.

title: In the land of junk food, the FDA proposes a front-of-pack nutrition label
summary: As almost 75% of US adults are overweight or obese, the US Food and Drug Administration has announced a simple, mandatory label to highlight quantities of saturated fats, sodium and added sugars. It remains to be seen if the regulation will be upheld in the Trump era.

title: After three years of war in Ukraine, many Russians take refuge in an 'inner black box'
summary: In Moscow, psychologists describe the struggles of those who lead parallel and contradictory lives, torn between implicit support for the Kremlin and hidden opposition to its 'special military operation' in Ukraine.

title: After Islamist knife attack in Mulhouse, French interior minister blames Algiers
summary: The French interior minister has accused the Algerian authorities of having refused 10 times a pass allowing the deportation of Brahim A., 37, suspected of stabbing a person to death and wounding five police officers in Mulhouse on Saturday. The man has 'a schizophrenic profile,' said the minister.

title: Ukraine: behind Donald Trump's recent anger, Volodymyr Zelensky's refusal to cede strategic mineral exploitation
summary: The American president's cascade of contemptuous remarks, threats and lies this week has much to do with the Ukrainian subsoil: Zelensky has refused to sign a draft agreement on these minerals, an affront to the White House.

title: Macron's warnings at the Paris Agricultural Show: 'There's no guarantee that food won't become a weapon tomorrow'
summary: On Saturday, the French president opened the annual agricultural event in a calm atmosphere, unlike the event last year. Making his rounds and meeting people, he repeatedly warned of the consequences of the current geopolitical situation.

title: Sex nerds: 'I had to justify myself at least 20 times explaining that, no, sex toys weren't "my thing"'
summary: According to the results of an Inserm-ANRS survey unveiled at the end of 2024, French people's sexuality has become much more diverse in recent years. But the multiplication of possibilities and practices is sometimes experienced as an injunction to perform, and makes those who don't explore them fear being considered out of the game.

title: How Elon Musk is applying the same brutal methods with the US federal government as with Twitter
summary: Drastic budget cuts, a commando mission by a small group of loyal followers, accusations of 'fraud'... The billionaire is trying to replicate the same procedures in the US administration as he used when taking control of the social network.

title: Raphaël Glucksmann, MEP: 'The small steps favored by European leaders are no longer enough, we need a giant leap'
summary: Under threat from Putin's Russia and their former ally the USA, European countries now have no other choice for their security and survival than to make the European Union a political, military and economic power, argues the social democrat MEP in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: Giorgia Meloni's government in Italy targets press and tightens grip on public broadcasting
summary: Government ministries and departments are stepping up complaints against the work of journalists. In the 2024 Reporters Without Borders freedom of the press index, the country dropped five places to 46th.

title: Israeli tanks enter West Bank for first time in decades, pledging long-term presence
summary: Israeli tanks rolled into the occupied West Bank on Sunday for the first time in over 20 years, marking a significant escalation in Israel’s ongoing military operations. Palestinian officials condemned the move as a 'dangerous escalation,' while Israel’s defense minister signaled a long-term presence, barring tens of thousands of displaced Palestinians from returning to their homes.

title: US federal agencies push back against Elon Musk’s job review ultimatum
summary: Multiple US federal agencies, including some led by Trump loyalists, are resisting Elon Musk’s directive for employees to justify their work or risk termination. The pushback signals a potential rift between Musk and key figures in the Trump administration, as unions and officials question the legitimacy of his authority over federal personnel.

title: Trump administration targets California's electric car standards
summary: Donald Trump has decided to tackle the Golden State's "exception" in setting its own pollutant emission standards and thereby improving air quality.
